title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of India and the Government of Sri Lanka for obtaining Indian Grant Assistance for Reconstruction/Repair of 49,000 houses in Northern, Eastern, Central and Uva Provinces of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the Government of India has agreed to provide grant assistance in a sum of Indian Rupees 13.19 billion (Approximately US $260 million) for the above purpose.  The project is to be implemented in three modes.  Under mode 1, about 38,000 houses in the Northern and Eastern Provinces will be reconstructed, with a total payment of  SLR 550,000 per house.  Payment will be made in four installments directly to the beneficiaries based on the progress of work.  Under mode 2, about 5000 houses in the Northern and Eastern will be repaired and payment will be made directly to the beneficiaries in three installments.  Under mode 3 about 6000 are to be reconstructed and of these, 4000 houses will be  reconstructed for Estates workers in the Central and Uva Provinces.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the two Governments, was approved by the Cabinet.
